search_information.query_displayed: Accounting for Racial Inequality in Southern Education: A Reply to Ramirez. Walters, Pamela Barnhouse And Others Sociology of Education

organic_results.title: Accounting for racial inequality in southern education: A reply to Ramirez
organic_results.snippet: It is not unusual for different sociological theories to give different explanations for observed patterns in the data. The relative merits of different theories can be adjudicated on the basis of data analyses only if the theories make opposing claims. It appears to us that Professor Ramirez's major quarrel with our study is with our theoretical perspective; he finds no serious problem with the basic analyses nor with the empirical relationships that we can identify. The difficulty with this theoretical disagreement, however, is that the results of our …
